unnormalised: **Automotive Industry Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches, Emphasizing Safety and Innovation**
normalised: Automotive Industry Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches, Emphasizing Safety and Innovation

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market is buzzing with anticipation as manufacturers prepare to unveil a diverse range of vehicles in the coming months. Dr. Arun Sharma, Head of Automotive Research at IIT Madras, notes a significant trend toward enhanced safety features. "We're seeing ADAS becoming increasingly common, even in mid-range models," he stated.
normalised: The Indian automotive market is buzzing with anticipation as manufacturers prepare to unveil a diverse range of vehicles in the coming months. Doctor Arun Sharma, Head of Automotive Research at I I T Madras, notes a significant trend toward enhanced safety features. "We're seeing A D A S becoming increasingly common, even in mid-range models," he stated.

unnormalised: Tata Motors is expected to launch the 'Nexon EV Max Pro' with an extended range, reportedly exceeding 450 km on a single charge, catering to the growing demand for electric vehicles. Mahindra & Mahindra are also teasing the launch of a revamped 'Scorpio-N' with enhanced off-roading capabilities, hoping to capture the adventure-seeking market segment.
normalised: Tata Motors is expected to launch the 'Nexon E V Max Pro' with an extended range, reportedly exceeding four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge, catering to the growing demand for electric vehicles. Mahindra and Mahindra are also teasing the launch of a revamped 'Scorpio-N' with enhanced off-roading capabilities, hoping to capture the adventure-seeking market segment.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki is rumored to be working on a budget-friendly hatchback, aiming to appeal to first-time car buyers, especially in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. Prices are expected to start around Rs. 5 lakhs. These launches are projected to further energize the automotive sector, contributing significantly to the country's economic growth and creating opportunities in related industries like auto component manufacturing, which is projected to expand by 20,000 sq ft of manufacturing space across Tamil Nadu. All eyes are on these launches as automakers seek to capture the imagination of the 'aam aadmi' during the upcoming Diwali season.
